name: Formula
summary: The Formula language is a scripting language used by Lotus Notes. It is often referred to as Formula language because many language elements start with the -character. Here is an example of a selection formula:SELECT NoteId  "NT0050D26"
japaneseSummary: Lotus Notesのスクリプト言語。記号「-」で始まる要素が多い。

name: A.NET A#A sharp
summary: A is a port of the Ada programming language to the Microsoft .NET platform. A is freely distributed by the Department of Computer Science at the United States Air Force Academy as a service to the Ada community under the terms of the GNU General Public License.
japaneseSummary: Ada言語の.NET移植版。GNU GPLで無償配布。

name: ABAP
summary: ABAP is a high-level programming language created by the German software company SAP SE. It is currently positioned, alongside Java, as the language for programming the SAP NetWeaver Application Server, which is part of the SAP NetWeaver platform for building business applications.
japaneseSummary: SAP社のビジネスアプリ開発言語。

name: ABC
summary: ABC is an imperative general-purpose programming language and integrated development environment (IDE) developed at Centrum Wiskunde  Informatica (CWI), in Amsterdam, Netherlands by Leo Geurts, Lambert Meertens, and Steven Pemberton. It is interactive, structured, high-level, and intended to be used instead of BASIC, Pascal, or AWK. It is intended for teaching or prototyping, but not as a systems-programming language.
japaneseSummary: アムステルダム発の命令型汎用プログラミング言語。

name: ACC
summary: ACC is a near-C compiler for the MS-DOS operating system on the IBM PC line of computers for programs. The compiler and compiled programs will run on any Intel 80386 or above PC running MS-DOS. Included with the compiler are a 386 assembler and a linker for combining multiple object files.
japaneseSummary: MS-DOS環境向け近似Cコンパイラ。

name: Accent Rational Synergy
summary: Rational Synergy is a software tool that provides software configuration management (SCM) capabilities for all artifacts related to software development including source code, documents and images as well as the final built software executable and libraries. Together these two tools form an integrated configuration management and change management environment that is used in software development organizations that need controlled SCM processes and an understanding of what is in a build of their software.
japaneseSummary: ソフトウェア開発全般の構成管理ツール。

name: Action
summary: Action! is a procedural programming language and integrated development environment written by Clinton Parker for the Atari 8-bit computers. The language, which is similar to ALGOL, compiles to high-performance code for the MOS Technology 6502 of the Atari computers. Action! was distributed on ROM cartridge by Optimized Systems Software starting in 1983.
japaneseSummary: アトリ8ビット機向けの手続き型プログラミング言語。

name: ActionScript
summary: ActionScript is an object-oriented programming language originally developed by Macromedia Inc.. It is influenced by HyperTalk, the scripting language for HyperCard. It is now an implementation of ECMAScript, though it originally arose as a sibling, both being influenced by HyperTalk.
japaneseSummary: Macromediaが開発したオブジェクト指向プログラミング言語。

name: Actor
summary: The Actor programming language was invented by Charles Duff of The Whitewater Group in 1988. It was an offshoot of some object-oriented extensions to the Forth language he had been working on.
japaneseSummary: 1988年、Forth言語のオブジェクト指向拡張から派生。

name: Ada
summary: Ada is a structured, statically typed, imperative, and object-oriented high-level programming language, inspired by Pascal and other languages. It has built-in language support for design by contract (DbC), extremely strong typing, explicit concurrency, tasks, synchronous message passing, protected objects, and non-determinism. Ada is an international technical standard, jointly defined by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC).
japaneseSummary: 構造化、静的型付け、命令型、オブジェクト指向のプログラミング言語。

name: Adenine Haystack
summary: Haystack is a project at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to research and develop several applications around personal information management and the Semantic Web. The most notable of those applications is the Haystack client, a research personal information manager (PIM) and one of the first to be based on semantic desktop technologies. The Haystack client is published as open source software under the BSD license.
japaneseSummary: MITの個人情報管理、意味網研究用オープンソースPIM。

name: AdvPL
summary: AdvPL is a proprietary programming language based on xBase. It was released in 1999 and is used for development of applications in the ERP Protheus made by TOTVS.
japaneseSummary: xBase系独自言語。TOTVS社のERP Protheus向け。

name: Agda
summary: Agda is a dependently typed functional programming language originally developed by Ulf Norell at Chalmers University of Technology with implementation described in his PhD thesis. The original Agda system was developed at Chalmers by Catarina Coquand in 1999. The current version, originally named Agda 2, is a full rewrite, which should be considered a new language that shares a name and tradition.
japaneseSummary: 依存型関数型プログラミング言語。

name: Agilent VEE
summary: Keysight VEE is a graphical dataflow programming software development environment from Keysight Technologies for automated test, measurement, data analysis and reporting. VEE originally stood for Visual Engineering Environment and developed by HP designated as HP VEE; it has since been officially renamed to Keysight VEE. Keysight VEE has been widely used in various industries, serving the entire stage of a product lifecycle, from design, validation to manufacturing.
japaneseSummary: 計測・制御用グラフィカルプログラミング環境。

name: Agora
summary: Agora is a reflective, prototype-based, object-oriented programming language that is based exclusively on message passing and not delegation. Agora was intended to show that even subject to that limit, it is possible to build a full object-oriented language that features inheritance, cloning, and reflective operators.
japaneseSummary: メッセージパッシングベースの反射型オブジェクト指向言語。

name: AIMMS
summary: AIMMS is a prescriptive analytics software company with offices in the Netherlands, United States, and Singapore.
japaneseSummary: AIMMSは、最適化分析ソフトウェア。

name: Aldor
summary: Aldor is a programming language. It is the successor of A as the extension language of the Axiom computer algebra system.
japaneseSummary: Axiomシステムの拡張言語。

name: Alef
summary: Alef is a discontinued concurrent programming language, designed as part of the Plan 9 operating system by Phil Winterbottom of Bell Labs.
japaneseSummary: Plan 9用、並列プログラミング言語（廃版）。

name: ALGOL
summary: ALGOL is a family of imperative computer programming languages originally developed in 1958. ALGOL heavily influenced many other languages and was the standard method for algorithm description used by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) in textbooks and academic sources for more than thirty years.
japaneseSummary: 命令型プログラミング言語。アルゴリズム記述の標準。

name: ALGOL 58
summary: ALGOL 58, originally named IAL, is a member of the ALGOL family of computer programming languages. It was an early compromise design soon superseded by ALGOL 60.
japaneseSummary: ALGOLファミリーの初期言語。ALGOL 60に取って代わられた。

name: ALGOL 60
summary: ALGOL 60 is a member of the ALGOL family of computer programming languages. ALGOL 60 was one of the first languages implementing function definitions. ALGOL 60 function definitions could be nested within one another, with lexical scope.
japaneseSummary: 関数定義とネストをサポートしたプログラミング言語。

name: ALGOL 68
summary: ALGOL 68 is an imperative programming language member of the ALGOL family that was conceived as a successor to the ALGOL 60 language, designed with the goal of a much wider scope of application and more rigorously defined syntax and semantics.
japaneseSummary: ALGOLファミリーの命令型言語。ALGOL 60の後継として設計された。

name: ALGOL W
summary: ALGOL W is a programming language. It is based on a proposal for ALGOL X by Niklaus Wirth and Tony Hoare as a successor to ALGOL 60. ALGOL W is a relatively simple upgrade of the original ALGOL 60, adding string, bitstring, complex number and reference to record data types and call-by-result passing of parameters, introducing the while statement, replacing switch with the case statement, and generally tightening up the language.
japaneseSummary: ALGOL 60の後継として設計された、簡潔なプログラミング言語。

name: Alice ML
summary: Alice ML is a general-purpose, high-level, multi-paradigm, functional programming language designed by the Programming Systems Laboratory at Saarland University, Saarbrcken, Germany. It is a dialect of Standard ML, augmented with support for lazy evaluation, concurrency and constraint programming.
japaneseSummary: サールランド大学開発の、標準ML方言で遅延評価、並行処理、制約プログラミングに対応した汎用関数型言語。

name: Alma-0
summary: Alma-0 is a multi-paradigm computer programming language. This language is an augmented version of the imperative Modula-2 language with logic-programming features and convenient backtracking ability. It is small, strongly typed, and combines constraint programming, a limited number of features inspired by logic programming and supports imperative paradigms.
japaneseSummary: 論理プログラミング機能を持つ、命令型言語の拡張版。

name: Amiga E
summary: Amiga E is a programming language created by Wouter van Oortmerssen on the Amiga computer. The work on the language started in 1991 and was first released in 1993. The original incarnation of Amiga E was being developed until 1997, when the popularity of the Amiga platform dropped significantly after the bankruptcy of Amiga intellectual property owner Escom AG.
japaneseSummary: Amigaコンピュータ向けプログラミング言語。

name: AMPL
summary: AMPL is an algebraic modeling language to describe and solve high-complexity problems for large-scale mathematical computing . It was developed by Robert Fourer, David Gay, and Brian Kernighan at Bell Laboratories. Problems are passed to solvers as nl files.
japaneseSummary: 大規模数学計算の複雑な問題を記述・解くための代数モデリング言語。

name: Apache Pig latin
summary: Apache Pig is a high-level platform for creating programs that run on Apache Hadoop. The language for this platform is called Pig Latin. Pig can execute its Hadoop jobs in MapReduce, Apache Tez, or Apache Spark.
japaneseSummary: Hadoop上で動作する高水準プログラミング言語。

name: Apex Salesforce.com Inc
summary: Salesforce, Inc. is an American cloud-based software company headquartered in San Francisco, California.
japaneseSummary: Salesforceのクラウドベース開発言語。

name: APL
summary: APL is a programming language developed in the 1960s by Kenneth E. Its central datatype is the multidimensional array. It has been an important influence on the development of concept modeling, spreadsheets, functional programming, and computer math packages.
japaneseSummary: 多次元配列を基本とするプログラミング言語。

name: AppleScript
summary: AppleScript is a scripting language created by Apple Inc. that facilitates automated control of Mac applications. First introduced in System 7, it is currently included in macOS in a package of automation tools.
japaneseSummary: macOSでMacアプリを自動制御するスクリプト言語。

name: APT
summary: APT is a high-level computer programming language most commonly used to generate instructions for numerically controlled machine tools. Ross is considered by many to be the father of APT: as head of the newly created Computer Applications Group of the Servomechanisms Laboratory at MIT in 1956, he led its technical effort. APT is a language and system that alleviates the tedious mathematics of writing toolpaths for numerically controlled equipment.
japaneseSummary: 数値制御工作機械の加工指令作成言語。

name: Arc
summary: Arc is a programming language, a dialect of the language Lisp, developed by Paul Graham and Robert Morris. It is free and open-source software released under the Artistic License 2.0.
japaneseSummary: Lisp方言のプログラミング言語。

name: ARexx
summary: ARexx is a Rexx interpreter for Amiga, written in 1987 by William S. An ARexx script can communicate with software that implements an ARexx port. An Amiga application can define a set of commands and functions for ARexx to address, thus making the capabilities of the software available to an ARexx script.
japaneseSummary: Amiga用Rexxインタプリタ。ARexxポート実装ソフトと通信可能。

name: Argus
summary: Argus is a programming language created at MIT by Barbara Liskov between 1982 and 1988, in collaboration with Maurice Herlihy, Paul Johnson, Robert Scheifler, and William Weihl. It is an extension of the CLU language, and utilizes most of the same syntax and semantics. Argus was designed to support the creation of distributed programs, by encapsulating related procedures within objects called guardians, and by supporting atomic operations called actions.
japaneseSummary: 分散プログラム作成を支援するオブジェクト指向言語。

name: ArkTS
summary: ArkTS is a high-level general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled, declarative, static type programming language developed by Huawei which is an extension superset of open-source TypeScript (TS), in turn a superset of JavaScript (JS) formerly used in July 2022 HarmonyOS 3.0 version, alongside its evolved precursor, extended TypeScript (eTS) built for HarmonyOS development as a shift toward declarative programming. ArkTS was first released in September 30, 2021 on OpenHarmony, and the ArkTS toolchain has shipped in DevEco Studio since version 3.1, released in 2022. Since, OpenHarmony 4.0 release on October 26, 2023, ArkTS APIs has been added to the open source community to contribute.
japaneseSummary: Huawei開発のTypeScript拡張言語。宣言型プログラミングを重視。

name: Assembly
summary: In computing, assembly language, often referred to simply as assembly and commonly abbreviated as ASM or asm, is any low-level programming language with a very strong correspondence between the instructions in the language and the architecture's machine code instructions. Assembly language usually has one statement per machine instruction (1:1), but constants, comments, assembler directives, symbolic labels of, e.g., memory locations, registers, and macros are generally also supported.
japaneseSummary: 機械語とほぼ1対1に対応する低級言語。

name: AssemblyScript
summary: AssemblyScript is a TypeScript-based programming language that is optimized for, and statically compiled to, WebAssembly. Resembling ECMAScript and JavaScript, but with static data types, the language is developed by the AssemblyScript Project with contributions from the AssemblyScript community.
japaneseSummary: TypeScriptを基にしたWebAssembly向けコンパイル言語。

name: ATS
summary: In computing, ATS is a multi-paradigm, general-purpose, high-level, functional programming language. It is a dialect of the programming language ML, designed by Hongwei Xi to unify computer programming with formal specification. ATS has support for combining theorem proving with practical programming through the use of advanced type systems.
japaneseSummary: 高階関数型言語。形式仕様と実用プログラミングを統合。

name: AutoHotkey
summary: AutoHotkey is a free and open-source custom scripting language for Microsoft Windows, primarily designed to provide easy keyboard shortcuts or hotkeys, fast macro-creation and software automation to allow users of most computer skill levels to automate repetitive tasks in any Windows application. It can easily extend or modify user interfaces. The installation package includes an extensive help file; web-based documentation is also available.
japaneseSummary: Windows向けフリースクリプト言語。ホットキー、マクロ、ソフトウェア自動化に特化。

name: AutoIt
summary: AutoIt is a freeware programming language for Microsoft Windows. In its earliest release, it was primarily intended to create automation scripts for Microsoft Windows programs but has since grown to include enhancements in both programming language design and overall functionality.
japaneseSummary: Windows用フリーの自動化スクリプト言語。

name: AutoLISP
summary: AutoLISP is a dialect of the programming language Lisp built specifically for use with the full version of AutoCAD and its derivatives, which include AutoCAD Civil 3D, AutoCAD Map 3D, AutoCAD Architecture and AutoCAD Mechanical. Neither the application programming interface (API) nor the interpreter to execute AutoLISP code is included in the AutoCAD LT product line. A subset of AutoLISP functions is included in the browser-based AutoCAD web app.
japaneseSummary: AutoCAD専用Lisp方言。AutoCAD製品群で動作。

name: Averest
summary: Averest is a synchronous programming language and set of tools to specify, verify, and implement reactive systems.
japaneseSummary: リアクティブシステムを記述・検証・実装する同期型プログラミング言語。

name: AWK
summary: AWK is a domain-specific language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool. Like sed and grep, it is a filter, and it is a standard feature of most Unix-like operating systems.
japaneseSummary: テキスト処理用言語。データ抽出・レポート作成に用いられる。

name: Axum
summary: Axum is a domain-specific concurrent programming language, based on the Actor model, that was under active development by Microsoft between 2009 and 2011. It is an object-oriented language based on the .NET Common Language Runtime using a C-like syntax which, being a domain-specific language, is intended for development of portions of a software application that is well-suited to concurrency.
japaneseSummary: アクターモデルに基づく、.NET上で動作する並列処理向けドメイン特化言語。

name: Babbage
summary: The GEC 4000 was a series of 1632-bit minicomputers produced by GEC Computers Ltd in the United Kingdom during the 1970s, 1980s and early 1990s.
japaneseSummary: 1970～90年代にGEC社が製造した16ビットミニコンピュータシリーズ。

name: Ballerina
summary: Ballerina is an general-purpose programming language designed by WSO2 for cloud-era application programmers. It is free and open-source software released under Apache License 2.
japaneseSummary: クラウドアプリ開発向け汎用プログラミング言語。

name: Bash
summary: In computing, Bash is an interactive command interpreter and command programming language developed for UNIX-like operating systems. Created in 1989 by Brian Fox for the GNU Project, it is supported by the Free Software Foundation and designed as a 100 free alternative for the Bourne shell (sh) and other proprietary Unix shells.
japaneseSummary: UNIX系OSのインタプリタ言語。Bourneシェル互換。

name: BASIC
summary: BASIC is a family of general-purpose, high-level programming languages designed for ease of use. The original version was created by John G.
japaneseSummary: 汎用高級言語で、使いやすさを重視。

name: bc basic calculator
summary: bc for basic calculator, is "an arbitrary-precision calculator language" with syntax similar to the C programming language. bc is typically used as either a mathematical scripting language or as an interactive mathematical shell.
japaneseSummary: 任意精度演算の計算機言語。C言語風構文。

name: BCPL
summary: BCPL is a procedural, imperative, and structured programming language. Originally intended for writing compilers for other languages, BCPL is no longer in common use. However, its influence is still felt because a stripped down and syntactically changed version of BCPL, called B, was the language on which the C programming language was based.
japaneseSummary: 手続き型、命令型の構造化プログラミング言語。C言語の基礎となった。

name: BeanShell
summary: BeanShell is a small, free, embeddable Java source interpreter with object scripting language features, written in Java.
japaneseSummary: Javaソースコードを埋め込み、オブジェクト指向スクリプト言語機能を持つJava製の軽量フリーインタプリタ。

name: BETA
summary: BETA is a pure object-oriented language originating within the "Scandinavian School" in object-orientation where the first object-oriented language Simula was developed.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向言語。シミュラ発祥の北欧流。

name: BLISS
summary: BLISS is a system programming language developed at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) by W. It was perhaps the best known system language until C debuted a few years later. When C was in its infancy, a few projects within Bell Labs debated the merits of BLISS vs.
japaneseSummary: カーネギーメロン大学のシステムプログラミング言語。

name: Blockly
summary: Blockly is a client-side library for the programming language JavaScript for creating block-based visual programming languages (VPLs) and editors. A project of Google, it is free and open-source software released under the Apache License 2.0.
japaneseSummary: JavaScriptベースのビジュアルプログラミング言語作成用ライブラリ。

name: BlooP
summary: BlooP and FlooP are simple programming languages designed by Douglas Hofstadter to illustrate a point in his book Gdel, Escher, Bach. BlooP is a Turing-incomplete programming language whose main control flow structure is a bounded loop. All programs in the language must terminate, and this language can only express primitive recursive functions.
japaneseSummary: チューリング非完全言語。ループ構造のみで原始帰納的関数しか表現できない。

name: Boo
summary: Boo is an object-oriented, statically typed, general-purpose programming language that seeks to make use of the Common Language Infrastructure's support for Unicode, internationalization, and web applications, while using a Python-inspired syntax and a special focus on language and compiler extensibility.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向、静的型付けの汎用言語。Unicode、国際化、Webアプリに対応。Python風構文で拡張性も高い。

name: Boomerang
summary: Boomerang is a programming language for writing lenseswell-behaved bidirectional transformations that operate on ad-hoc, textual data formats.
japaneseSummary: テキストデータの双方向変換を記述するプログラミング言語。

name: Bosque
summary: Bosque is a free and open-source programming language designed  developed by Microsoft that was inspired by the syntax and types of TypeScript and the semantics of ML and NodeJavaScript.
japaneseSummary: Microsoft開発のオープンソース言語。TypeScriptとML、Node.jsを参考に設計。

name: C Shell csh
summary: The C shell is a Unix shell created by Bill Joy while he was a graduate student at University of California, Berkeley in the late 1970s. It has been widely distributed, beginning with the 2BSD release of the Berkeley Software Distribution (BSD) which Joy first distributed in 1978. Other early contributors to the ideas or the code were Michael Ubell, Eric Allman, Mike O'Brien and Jim Kulp.
japaneseSummary: UNIXシェル。バークレーで開発された。

name: C--
summary: C-- is a C-like programming language, designed to be generated mainly by compilers for high-level languages rather than written by human programmers. It was created by functional programming researchers Simon Peyton Jones and Norman Ramsey. Unlike many other intermediate languages, it is represented in plain ASCII text, not bytecode or another binary format.
japaneseSummary: 高水準言語コンパイラ向け中間言語。

name: C
summary: C is a data-parallel superset of ANSI C with synchronous semantics.
japaneseSummary: C言語の同期型データ並列拡張。

name: CAL
summary: CAL was the programming language used within CSIDE the ClientServer Integrated Development Environment in Microsoft Dynamics NAV and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central up until version 14. It has been replaced by AL. CAL is a Database specific programming language, and is primarily used for retrieving, inserting and modifying records in a Navision database.
japaneseSummary: NAVisionデータベース操作言語。

name: C#
summary: C is a general-purpose high-level programming language supporting multiple paradigms.
japaneseSummary: 汎用プログラミング言語。複数のプログラミング手法に対応。

name: Caml
summary: Caml is a multi-paradigm, general-purpose, high-level, functional programming language which is a dialect of the ML programming language family. Caml was developed in France at French Institute for Research in Computer Science and Automation (INRIA) and cole normale suprieure (Paris) (ENS).
japaneseSummary: ML言語派生、多様性を持つ関数型言語。

name: Carbon
summary: Carbon is an experimental programming language designed for connectiveness with C. The project is open-source and was started at Google. He stated that Carbon was created to be a C successor.
japaneseSummary: C言語の後継を目指した実験的なプログラミング言語。

name: Categorical
wikipediaTitle: List of programming languages by type
summary: This is a list of notable programming languages, grouped by type.
japaneseSummary: カテゴリ別に分類されたプログラミング言語一覧。

name: Catrobat
summary: Catrobat is a block-based visual programming language and Open Source Software non-profit project.
japaneseSummary: ビジュアルプログラミング言語。オープンソース。

name: Cayenne Lennart Augustsson
summary: Lennart Augustsson is a Swedish computer scientist. He was formerly a lecturer at the Computing Science Department at Chalmers University of Technology. His research field is functional programming and implementations of functional programming languages.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語。

name: Cecil
summary: Cecil is a pure object-oriented programming language that was developed by Craig Chambers at the University of Washington in 1992 to be part of the Vortex project there. Cecil has many similarities to other object-oriented languages, most notably Objective-C, Modula-3, and Self. The main goals of the project were extensibility, orthogonality, efficiency, and ease-of-use.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向言語。拡張性・直交性・効率・使いやすさを重視。

name: CEEMAC
summary: CEEMAC is a programming language developed in the 1980s for the Apple II family of computers. It was developed by Brooke Boering and published by Vagabondo Enterprises,
japaneseSummary: 1980年代にApple II用として開発されたプログラミング言語。

name: Ceylon
summary: Ceylon was an object-oriented, strongly statically typed programming language with an emphasis on immutability, created by Red Hat. Ceylon programs run on the Java virtual machine (JVM), and could be compiled to JavaScript.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向、静的型付け、不変性を重視したJVM言語。

name: CFEngine
summary: CFEngine is a configuration management system, written by Mark Burgess. Its primary function is to provide automated configuration and maintenance of large-scale computer systems, including the unified management of servers, desktops, consumer and industrial devices, embedded network devices, mobile smartphones, and tablet computers.
japaneseSummary: 大規模システムの構成管理ツール。

name: Ch
summary: CH is a proprietary cross-platform C and C interpreter and scripting language environment. It was designed by Harry Cheng as a scripting language for beginners to learn mathematics, computing, numerical analysis, and programming in CC. Ch is now developed and marketed by SoftIntegration, Inc..
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォームのC/C++インタプリタ言語。

name: Charm
summary: Charm is a computer programming language devised in the early 1990s with similarities to the RTL2, Pascal and C languages in addition to containing some unique features of its own. The Charm language is defined by a context-free grammar amenable to being processed by recursive descent parser as described in seminal books on compiler design.
japaneseSummary: 1990年代に開発された、RTL2、Pascal、C言語と類似点を持つコンパイラ設計で有名な再帰下降パーサに対応する文脈自由文法に基づくプログラミング言語。

name: CHILL
summary: In computing, CHILL is a procedural programming language designed for use in telecommunication switches. The language is still used for legacy systems in some telecommunication companies and for signal box programming.
japaneseSummary: 電話交換機向け手続き型言語。

name: CHIP-8
summary: CHIP-8 is an interpreted programming language, developed by Joseph Weisbecker on his 1802 microprocessor. It was initially used on the COSMAC VIP and Telmac 1800, which were 8-bit microcomputers made in the mid-1970s.
japaneseSummary: 1970年代の8ビットマイクロコンピュータで用いられたインタプリタ言語。

name: Chronological
summary: This is a record of notable programming languages, by decade.
japaneseSummary: 時代別の著名なプログラミング言語の記録。

name: ChucK
summary: ChucK is a concurrent, strongly timed audio programming language for real-time synthesis, composition, and performance, which runs on Linux, Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows, and iOS. It is designed to favor readability and flexibility for the programmer over other considerations such as raw performance. Another key feature is the ability to live code; adding, removing, and modifying code on the fly, while the program is running, without stopping or restarting.
japaneseSummary: リアルタイムオーディオ処理の並列型プログラミング言語。

name: Cilk also Cilk++ and Cilk plus
summary: Cilk, Cilk, Cilk Plus and OpenCilk are general-purpose programming languages designed for multithreaded parallel computing. They are based on the C and C programming languages, which they extend with constructs to express parallel loops and the forkjoin idiom.
japaneseSummary: マルチスレッド並列処理向けC言語拡張言語。

name: Claire
summary: Claire is a high-level functional and object-oriented programming language with rule processing abilities. It was designed by Yves Caseau at Bouygues' e-Lab research laboratory, and received its final definition in 2004.
japaneseSummary: 高階関数型・オブジェクト指向言語。ルール処理も可能。

name: Clarion
summary: Clarion is a commercial, proprietary, fourth-generation programming language (4GL), multi-paradigm, programming language and integrated development environment (IDE) from SoftVelocity used to program database applications. It is compatible with indexed sequential access method (ISAM), Structured Query Language (SQL), and ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) data access methods, reads and writes several flat file desktop database formats including ASCII, comma-separated values (CSV), DOS (binary), FoxPro, Clipper, dBase, and some relational databases via ODBC, Microsoft SQL Server, Sybase SQL Anywhere, and Oracle Database through the use of accelerated native database drivers, and XML, Clarion can be used to output to HTML, XML, plain text, and Portable Document Format (PDF), among others.
japaneseSummary: データベースアプリ開発向け商用4GL。ISAM、SQL、ADOなど多様なデータアクセスに対応。

name: classic
summary: Visual Basic (VB), sometimes referred to as Classic Visual Basic, is a third-generation programming language based on BASIC, as well as an associated integrated development environment (IDE). Visual Basic was developed by Microsoft for Windows, and is known for supporting rapid application development (RAD) of graphical user interface (GUI) applications, event-driven programming, and both consumption and development of components via the Component Object Model (COM) technology.
japaneseSummary: Windows向けGUIアプリ開発言語。イベント駆動、COM対応。

name: Clean
summary: Clean is a general-purpose purely functional programming language. Originally called the Concurrent Clean System or the Clean System, it has been developed by a group of researchers from the Radboud University in Nijmegen since 1987. Although development of the language has slowed, some researchers are still working in the language.
japaneseSummary: 純粋関数型言語。1987年から開発中。

name: Clipper
summary: Clipper is an xBase compiler that implements a variant of the xBase computer programming language. It is used to create or extend software programs that originally ran usually on DOS. Although it is a powerful general-purpose programming language, it was used mainly to create database business programs.
japaneseSummary: xBase言語のコンパイラ。主にデータベース業務アプリ開発に用いられた。

name: CLIPS
summary: CLIPS is a public-domain software tool for building expert systems. The syntax and name were inspired by Charles Forgy's OPS5. The first versions of CLIPS were developed starting in 1985 at the NASA Johnson Space Center until 1996, when the development group's responsibilities ceased to focus on expert system technology.
japaneseSummary: 専門家システム構築用、パブリックドメインの言語。

name: Clojure
summary: Clojure is a dynamic and functional dialect of the programming language Lisp on the Java platform.
japaneseSummary: Java仮想マシン上で動作する動的関数型Lisp方言。

name: CLU
summary: CLU is a programming language created at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) by Barbara Liskov and her students starting in 1973. While it did not find extensive use, it introduced many features that are used widely now, and is seen as a step in the development of object-oriented programming (OOP).
japaneseSummary: MITでオブジェクト指向プログラミングの先駆けとなった言語。

name: CMS EXEC
summary: CMS EXEC, or EXEC, is an interpreted, command procedure control, computer scripting language used by the CMS EXEC Processor supplied with the IBM Virtual MachineConversational Monitor System (VMCMS) operating system.
japaneseSummary: IBM CMSオペレーティングシステムの命令制御スクリプト言語。

name: CMS-2
summary: CMS-2 is an embedded systems programming language used by the United States Navy. It was an early attempt to develop a standardized high-level computer programming language intended to improve code portability and reusability. CMS-2 was developed primarily for the US Navys tactical data systems (NTDS).
japaneseSummary: 米海軍用組込みシステム向け、高水準言語。

name: COBOL
summary: COBOL is a compiled English-like computer programming language designed for business use. It is an imperative, procedural, and, since 2002, object-oriented language. COBOL is primarily used in business, finance, and administrative systems for companies and governments.
japaneseSummary: ビジネス向け、手続き型のコンパイル言語。オブジェクト指向もサポート。

name: CobolScript
summary: CobolScript is a programming language created by Matthew Dean and Charles Schereda of Deskware in 1999. The language was intended to provide web-enabled COBOL, and was targeted at businesses using legacy software written in that language.
japaneseSummary: COBOLをWeb対応させたプログラミング言語。

name: Cobra
summary: Cobra is a discontinued general-purpose, object-oriented programming language. Cobra is designed by Charles Esterbrook, and runs on the Microsoft .NET and Mono platforms. It is strongly influenced by Python, C, Eiffel, Objective-C, and other programming languages.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向の汎用言語。.NET/Monoで動作。

name: CoffeeScript
summary: CoffeeScript is a programming language that compiles to JavaScript.
japaneseSummary: JavaScriptにコンパイルされるプログラミング言語。

name: ColdFusion
summary: Adobe ColdFusion is a commercial rapid web-application development computing platform created by J. ColdFusion was originally designed to make it easier to connect simple HTML pages to a database.
japaneseSummary: Adobe社のWebアプリケーション開発プラットフォーム。

name: COMAL
summary: COMAL is a computer programming language developed in Denmark by Brge R. It was based on the BASIC programming language, adding multi-line statements and well-defined subroutines among other additions.
japaneseSummary: デンマークで開発されたBASIC系のプログラミング言語。複数行文やサブルーチンを備える。

name: COMIT
summary: COMIT was the first string processing language, developed on the IBM 7007000 series computers by Victor Yngve, University of Chicago, and collaborators at MIT from 1957 to 1965.
japaneseSummary: 1957年から1965年にかけて、シカゴ大学・MITの研究者らがIBM 7000シリーズで開発した、最初の文字列処理言語。

name: Common Lisp
summary: Common Lisp (CL) is a dialect of the Lisp programming language, published in American National Standards Institute (ANSI) standard document ANSI INCITS 226-1994 (S2018). The Common Lisp HyperSpec, a hyperlinked HTML version, has been derived from the ANSI Common Lisp standard.
japaneseSummary: ANSI規格に基づくLisp方言。

name: Comparison
summary: Programming languages are used for controlling the behavior of a machine.
japaneseSummary: 機械の動作を制御する言語。

name: COMPASS
summary: COMPASS, COMPrehensive ASSembler, is any of a family of macro assembly languages for Control Data Corporation's 3000 series, and for the 60-bit CDC 6000 series, 7600 and Cyber 70 and 170 series mainframe computers. While the architectures are very different, the macro and conditional assembly facilities are similar.
japaneseSummary: 制御データ社のメインフレーム向けマクロアセンブラ。

name: Component Pascal
summary: Component Pascal is a programming language in the tradition of Niklaus Wirth's Pascal, Modula-2, Oberon and Oberon-2. It bears the name of the language Pascal and preserves its heritage, but is incompatible with Pascal. Instead, it is a minor variant and refinement of Oberon-2 with a more expressive type system and built-in string support.
japaneseSummary: Oberon-2の改良型言語。Pascal系統だが互換性なし。

name: COMTRAN
summary: COMTRAN is an early programming language developed at IBM. It was intended as the business programming equivalent of the scientific programming language FORTRAN. Developed by Bob Bemer, in 1957, the language was the first to feature the programming language element known as a picture clause.
japaneseSummary: IBMが開発した、FORTRANに準じたビジネス向け初期言語。ピクチャ句を初めて採用。

name: Concurrent Pascal
summary: Concurrent Pascal is a programming language designed by Per Brinch Hansen for writing concurrent computing programs such as operating systems and real-time computing monitoring systems on shared memory computers.
japaneseSummary: 共有メモリ型並列処理用プログラミング言語。

name: Constraint Handling Rules
summary: Constraint Handling Rules (CHR) is a declarative, rule-based programming language, introduced in 1991 by Thom Frhwirth at the time with European Computer-Industry Research Centre (ECRC) in Munich, Germany.
japaneseSummary: 制約処理規則(CHR)は、宣言型ルールベース言語。

name: CORAL
summary: CORAL, short for Computer On-line Real-time Applications Language is a programming language originally developed in 1964 at the Royal Radar Establishment (RRE), Malvern, Worcestershire, in the United Kingdom. The R was originally for "radar", not "real-time". It was influenced primarily by JOVIAL, and thus ALGOL, but is not a subset of either.
japaneseSummary: 1964年英国で開発されたリアルタイムアプリケーション言語。

name: CorVision
summary: CorVision is a fourth generation programming tool (4GL) currently owned by Attunity, Inc. CorVision was developed by Cortex Corporation for the VAXVMS ISAM environment. Although Cortex beta tested CorVision-10 which was generated for PCs but CorVision itself stayed anchored on VMS.
japaneseSummary: VAX/VMS向け4GL。アチュニティ社が所有。

name: COWSEL
summary: COWSEL is a programming language designed between 1964 and 1966 by Robin Popplestone. It was based on an reverse Polish notation (RPN) form of the language Lisp, combined with some ideas from Combined Programming Language (CPL).
japaneseSummary: 1964～66年にポプストーンが開発。逆ポーランド記法のLispとCPLを融合した言語。

name: CPL
summary: CPL is a multi-paradigm programming language developed in the early 1960s. It is an early ancestor of the C language via the BCPL and B languages.
japaneseSummary: 1960年代初期に開発された多重パラダイム言語。C言語の祖先。

name: Cryptol
summary: Cryptol is a domain-specific programming language for cryptography developed by the Portland, Oregon based software development firm, Galois, Inc. It is free and open-source software released under a BSD 3-clause software license.
japaneseSummary: 暗号技術向け専用プログラミング言語。

name: Crystal
summary: Crystal is a high-level general-purpose, object-oriented programming language, designed and developed by Ary Borenszweig, Juan Wajnerman, Brian Cardiff and more than 400 contributors. With syntax inspired by the language Ruby, it is a compiled language with static type-checking, but specifying the types of variables or method arguments is generally unneeded. Types are resolved by an advanced global type inference algorithm.
japaneseSummary: Rubyを参考に開発された、静的型付けのオブジェクト指向言語。

name: Csound
summary: Csound is a domain-specific computer programming language for audio programming. It is named Csound because it is written in the language C, in contrast to some of its predecessors. It is free and open-source software, released under the GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL) 2.1 or later.
japaneseSummary: オーディオプログラミング専用のプログラミング言語。

name: Cuneiform
summary: Cuneiform is an open-source workflow language for large-scale scientific data analysis. It is a statically typed functional programming language promoting parallel computing. In this, Cuneiform is the attempt to close the gap between scientific workflow systems like Taverna, KNIME, or Galaxy and large-scale data analysis programming models like MapReduce or Pig Latin while offering the generality of a functional programming language.
japaneseSummary: 大規模科学データ分析のためのオープンソース関数型言語。並列処理を促進。

name: Curl
summary: Curl is a reflective object-oriented programming language for interactive web applications, whose goal is to provide a smoother transition between content formatting and computer programming. The Curl implementation initially consisted of an interpreter only; a compiler was added later.
japaneseSummary: インタラクティブWebアプリ向け反射型オブジェクト指向言語。

name: Curry
summary: Curry is a declarative programming language, an implementation of the functional logic programming paradigm, and based on the Haskell language.
japaneseSummary: 宣言型関数型論理プログラミング言語。Haskellを基盤とする。

name: Cybil
summary: Cybil was a Pascal-like language developed at Control Data Corporation for the Cyber computer family. Cybil was used as the implementation language for the NOSVE operating system on the CDC Cyber series and was also used to write the eOS operating system for the ETA10 supercomputer in the 1980s.
japaneseSummary: サイビルは、CDCサイバーコンピュータ向けのパスクアル風言語。

name: Cyclone
summary: The Cyclone programming language was intended to be a safe dialect of the C language. It avoids buffer overflows and other vulnerabilities that are possible in C programs by design, without losing the power and convenience of C as a tool for system programming. It is no longer supported by its original developers, with the reference tooling not supporting 64-bit platforms.
japaneseSummary: C言語の安全な方言。バッファオーバーフロー対策で脆弱性を軽減。

name: Cython
summary: Cython is a superset of the programming language Python, which allows developers to write Python code that yields performance comparable to that of C.
japaneseSummary: Pythonの高速化を実現する言語。

name: Dart
summary: Dart is a programming language designed by Lars Bak and Kasper Lund and developed by Google. It can be used to develop web and mobile apps as well as server and desktop applications.
japaneseSummary: Google開発のWeb・モバイル・サーバ・デスクトップアプリ開発言語。

name: Darwin
summary: Darwin is a closed source programming language developed by Gaston Gonnet and colleagues at ETH Zurich. It is used to develop the OMA orthology inference software, which was also initially developed by Gonnet. The language backend consists of the kernel, responsible for performing simple mathematical calculations, for transporting and storing data and for interpreting the user's commands, and the library, a set of programs which can perform more complicated calculations.
japaneseSummary: チューリッヒ工科大学のGonnet氏らが開発した、OMA相同性推論ソフト開発用閉鎖ソース言語。

name: DataFlex
summary: DataFlex is an object-oriented high-level programming language and a fourth generation visual tool for developing Windows, web and mobile software applications on one framework-based platform. It was introduced and developed by Data Access Corporation beginning in 1982.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向の高級言語で、Windows/Web/モバイルアプリ開発に用いられる。

name: Datalog
summary: Datalog is a declarative logic programming language. While it is syntactically a subset of Prolog, Datalog generally uses a bottom-up rather than top-down evaluation model. It is often used as a query language for deductive databases.
japaneseSummary: 宣言型論理プログラミング言語。下向き評価を多用し、推論データベースの問合せ言語として使われる。

name: DATATRIEVE
summary: DATATRIEVE is a database query and report writer tool originally from Digital Equipment Corporation. DATATRIEVE's command structure is nearly plain English, and it is an early example of a Fourth Generation Language (4GL).
japaneseSummary: データ検索・レポート作成ツール（4GL）。

name: DAX Data Analysis Expressions
summary: Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) is the native formula and query language for Microsoft PowerPivot, Power BI Desktop and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) Tabular models. DAX includes some of the functions that are used in Excel formulas with additional functions that are designed to work with relational data and perform dynamic aggregation. It is, in part, an evolution of the Multidimensional Expression (MDX) language developed by Microsoft for Analysis Services multidimensional models combined with Excel formula functions.
japaneseSummary: Power BI/SSASの表形式モデル向け計算言語。

name: dBase
summary: dBase was one of the first database management systems for microcomputers and the most successful in its day.
japaneseSummary: マイクロコンピュータ向け初期のデータベース管理システム。

name: dc
summary: dc is a cross-platform reverse-Polish calculator which supports arbitrary-precision arithmetic. It was written by Lorinda Cherry and Robert Morris at Bell Labs. It is one of the oldest Unix utilities, preceding even the invention of the C programming language.
japaneseSummary: 逆ポーランド記法の任意精度演算ツール。

name: Delphi
summary: Delphi is a general-purpose programming language and a software product that uses the Delphi dialect of the Object Pascal programming language and provides an integrated development environment (IDE) for rapid application development of desktop, mobile, web, and console software, currently developed and maintained by Embarcadero Technologies.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向言語Delphi。統合開発環境でアプリ開発を高速化。

name: DIBOL
summary: DIBOL or Digital's Business Oriented Language is a general-purpose, procedural, imperative programming language that was designed for use in Management Information Systems (MIS) software development. It was developed from 1970 to 1993.
japaneseSummary: 経営情報システム開発向け汎用手続き型言語。

name: DinkC
summary: Dink Smallwood is an action role-playing video game developed by Robinson Technologies at the time consisting of Seth Robinson, Justin Martin, and Greg Smith. It was first released in 1998 before being released as freeware on October 17, 1999. Mitch Brink composed several of the game's music tracks while others are MIDI forms of classical music such as Debussy's "Reverie".
japaneseSummary: DinkCは、1998年にリリースされたアクションRPG。

name: Dog
summary: Sepandar David Kamvar, also known as Sep Kamvar, is a computer scientist, artist, author and entrepreneur. He is a cofounder of Mosaic, an AI-powered construction company, Celo, a cryptocurrency protocol, and Wildflower Schools, a decentralized network of Montessori microschools. He was previously a Professor of Media Arts and Sciences and LG Career Development Chair at MIT, and director of the Social Computing group at the MIT Media Lab.
japaneseSummary: プログラミング言語「Dog」に関する情報なし。

name: Draco
summary: Draco was a shareware programming language created by Chris Gray.
japaneseSummary: クリス・グレイ氏が開発したシェアウェア言語。

name: DRAKON
summary: DRAKON is a free and open source algorithmic visual programming and modeling language developed as part of the defunct Soviet Union Buran space program in 1986 following the need in increase of software development productivity.
japaneseSummary: アルゴリズム可視化プログラミング言語。

name: Dylan
summary: Dylan is a multi-paradigm programming language that includes support for functional and object-oriented programming (OOP), and is dynamic and reflective while providing a programming model designed to support generating efficient machine code, including fine-grained control over dynamic and static behaviors. It was created in the early 1990s by a group led by Apple Computer.
japaneseSummary: 関数型・オブジェクト指向をサポートする、高性能な動的反射型言語。

name: DYNAMO
summary: DYNAMO is a simulation language and accompanying graphical notation developed within the system dynamics analytical framework. It was originally for industrial dynamics but was soon extended to other applications, including population and resource studies and urban planning.
japaneseSummary: システムダイナミクスを用いたシミュレーション言語。

name: Ease
summary: Ease is a general purpose parallel programming language. It is designed by Steven Ericsson-Zenith, a researcher at Yale University, the Institute for Advanced Science  Engineering in Silicon Valley, California, the Ecole Nationale Suprieure des Mines de Paris, and the Pierre and Marie Curie University, the science department of the Sorbonne.
japaneseSummary: 並列処理の汎用プログラミング言語。

name: Easy PLI
summary: PLI is a procedural, imperative computer programming language initially developed by IBM. It is designed for scientific, engineering, business and system programming. It has been in continuous use by academic, commercial and industrial organizations since it was introduced in the 1960s.
japaneseSummary: IBMが開発した手続き型言語。科学技術、業務、システム開発に用いられる。

name: EASYTRIEVE PLUS
summary: Easytrieve is a report generator, sold by CA Technologies. Easytrieve Classic and Easytrieve Plus are two available versions of this programming language primarily designed to generate reports and are used by large corporations operating in mainframe, UNIX, Linux, and Microsoft Windows environments.
japaneseSummary: メインフレーム向けレポート生成言語。

name: ECMAScript
summary: ECMAScript is a standard for scripting languages, including JavaScript, JScript, and ActionScript. It is best known as a JavaScript standard intended to ensure the interoperability of web pages across different web browsers. It is standardized by Ecma International in the document ECMA-262.
japaneseSummary: JavaScriptなどのスクリプト言語の標準規格。互換性を確保する。

name: Edinburgh IMP
summary: Edinburgh IMP is a development of Atlas Autocode, initially developed around 1966-1969 at the University of Edinburgh, Scotland. It is a general-purpose programming language which was used heavily for systems programming.
japaneseSummary: エディンバラ大学のシステムプログラミング言語。

name: EGL
summary: EGL, originally developed by IBM and now available as the EDT open source project under the Eclipse Public License (EPL), is a programming technology designed to meet the challenges of modern, multi-platform application development by providing a common language and programming model across languages, frameworks, and runtime platforms.
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォーム開発向け、共通言語。

name: Eiffel
summary: Eiffel is an object-oriented programming language designed by Bertrand Meyer and Eiffel Software. The first version was released in 1986.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向プログラミング言語。1986年に登場。

name: ELAN
summary: ELAN is an interpreted educational programming language for learning and teaching systematic programming.
japaneseSummary: 体系的なプログラミング学習用インタプリタ言語。

name: Elixir
summary: Elixir is a functional, concurrent, high-level general-purpose programming language that runs on the BEAM virtual machine, which is also used to implement the Erlang programming language. The latter is supported by compile-time metaprogramming with macros and polymorphism via protocols.
japaneseSummary: 関数型、並行処理対応の汎用プログラミング言語。

name: Elm
summary: Elm is a domain-specific programming language for declaratively creating web browser-based graphical user interfaces. Elm is purely functional, and is developed with emphasis on usability, performance, and robustness.
japaneseSummary: 宣言型Web UIプログラミング言語。純粋関数型で、使いやすさと性能重視。

name: Emacs Lisp
summary: Emacs Lisp is a Lisp dialect made for Emacs. It is used for implementing most of the editing functionality built into Emacs, the remainder being written in C, as is the Lisp interpreter.
japaneseSummary: Emacsの機能拡張に特化したLisp方言。

name: Emerald
summary: Emerald is a distributed, object-oriented programming language developed in the 1980s by Andrew P.
japaneseSummary: 分散オブジェクト指向言語。

name: Epigram
summary: Epigram is a functional programming language with dependent types, and the integrated development environment (IDE) usually packaged with the language. Epigram's type system is strong enough to express program specifications. The goal is to support a smooth transition from ordinary programming to integrated programs and proofs whose correctness can be checked and certified by the compiler.
japaneseSummary: 依存型付き関数型言語。統合開発環境付属。プログラム仕様記述力が高く、証明可能なプログラム開発を支援。

name: Erlang
summary: Erlang is a general-purpose, concurrent, functional high-level programming language, and a garbage-collected runtime system. The term Erlang is used interchangeably with ErlangOTP, or Open Telecom Platform (OTP), which consists of the Erlang runtime system, several ready-to-use components (OTP) mainly written in Erlang, and a set of design principles for Erlang programs.
japaneseSummary: 並行処理機能を持つ関数型高水準言語。

name: es
summary: rc is the command-line interpreter for Version 10 Unix and Plan 9 from Bell Labs operating systems. It resembles the Bourne shell, but its syntax is somewhat simpler. It was created by Tom Duff, who is better known for an unusual C programming language construct.
japaneseSummary: Bell LabsのUnix/Plan 9のコマンドラインインタプリタ。Bourneシェルに似るが、構文は簡潔。

name: Escher
summary: Escher is a declarative programming language that supports both functional programming and logic programming models, developed by J.W. It was designed mostly as a research and teaching vehicle. The basic view of programming exhibited by Escher and related languages is that a program is a representation of a theory in some logic framework, and the program's execution (computation) is a deduction from the theory.
japaneseSummary: 論理・関数型宣言型言語。研究・教育用。

name: ESPOL
summary: The Executive Systems Problem Oriented Language (ESPOL) is a programming language, a superset of ALGOL 60, that provides abilities of what would later be termed a system programming language or machine oriented high order language (mohol), such as interrupting a processor on a multiprocessing system. ESPOL was used to write the Master Control Program (MCP) on Burroughs computer systems from the B5000 to the B6700. The single-pass compiler for ESPOL could compile over 250 lines per second.
japaneseSummary: ALGOL 60のスーパーセット。マルチプロセッサ制御など、システムプログラミングに特化した言語。

name: Esterel
summary: Esterel is a synchronous programming language for the development of complex reactive systems. As a consequence, it is well suited for control-dominated model designs.
japaneseSummary: 同期型プログラミング言語。反応型システム開発に適す。

name: Etoys
summary: Etoys is a child-friendly computer environment and object-oriented prototype-based programming language for use in education.
japaneseSummary: 児童向けオブジェクト指向プロトタイプ言語。

name: Euclid
summary: Euclid is an imperative programming language for writing verifiable programs. It was designed in the mid-1970s by Butler Lampson and James G. The implementation was led by Ric Holt at the University of Toronto and James Cordy was the principal programmer for the first implementation of the compiler.
japaneseSummary: 検証可能なプログラム記述のための命令型言語。

name: Euler
summary: Euler is a programming language created by Niklaus Wirth and Helmut Weber, conceived as an extension and generalization of ALGOL 60. The designers' goals were to create a language that is:Simpler, yet more flexible, than ALGOL 60 Useful and processed with reasonable efficiency Definable with rigorous formality
japaneseSummary: ALGOL 60の拡張言語。簡潔で柔軟、効率的な処理を目標とした。

name: Euphoria
summary: Euphoria is a programming language created by Robert Craig of Rapid Deployment Software in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Initially developed on the Atari ST, the first commercial release was for MS-DOS as proprietary software. OpenEuphoria is currently available for Windows, Linux, macOS and three flavors of BSD.
japaneseSummary: カナダ発のプログラミング言語。

name: EXEC 2
summary: EXEC 2 is an interpreted, command procedure control, computer scripting language used by the EXEC 2 Processor originally supplied with the CMS component of the IBM Virtual MachineSystem Product (VMSP) operating system.
japaneseSummary: IBM VM/CMS用コマンド処理スクリプト言語。

name: Executable UML
summary: Executable UML is both a software development method and a highly abstract software language. It was described for the first time in 2002 in the book "Executable UML: A Foundation for Model-Driven Architecture". The language "combines a subset of the UML graphical notation with executable semantics and timing rules." The Executable UML method is the successor to the ShlaerMellor method.
japaneseSummary: モデル駆動アーキテクチャの基盤言語。UMLを拡張し、実行可能。

name: Ezhil
summary: Ezhil, in Tamil language script, is a compact, open source, interpreted, programming language, originally designed to enable native-Tamil speaking students, K-12 age-group to learn computer programming, and enable learning numeracy and computing, outside of linguistic expertise in predominately English language-based computer systems.
japaneseSummary: タミル語で記述できる、コンパクトなオープンソースのインタプリタ言語。

name: F
summary: F is a high-level, multi-paradigm, functional and object-oriented programming language inspired by the languages ML, Caml, and OCaml, and intended for program verification. It is a joint project of Microsoft Research, and the French Institute for Research in Computer Science and Automation (Inria). For execution, programs written in F can be translated to OCaml, F, C, WebAssembly, or assembly language.
japaneseSummary: ML系言語を基にした、高水準の関数型・オブジェクト指向言語。検証を目的とし、OCamlなどへ変換可能。

name: F# F sharp
summary: F is a general-purpose, high-level, strongly typed, multi-paradigm programming language that encompasses functional, imperative, and object-oriented programming methods. It is most often used as a cross-platform Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) language on .NET, but can also generate JavaScript and graphics processing unit (GPU) code.
japaneseSummary: F#は、.NETで動作するクロスプラットフォームの多様性言語。

name: Factor
summary: Factor is a stack-oriented programming language created by Slava Pestov. Factor is dynamically typed and has automatic memory management, as well as powerful metaprogramming features. The language has a single implementation featuring a self-hosted optimizing compiler and an interactive development environment.
japaneseSummary: スタック指向のメタプログラミング言語。

name: Fantom
summary: Fantom is a general-purpose object-oriented programming language, created by Brian Frank and Andy Frank. Its stated goal is to provide a standard library API.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向の汎用プログラミング言語。標準ライブラリAPIを提供。

name: FAUST
summary: FAUST is a domain-specific purely functional programming language for implementing signal processing algorithms in the form of libraries, audio plug-ins, or standalone applications. A FAUST program denotes a signal processor: a mathematical function that is applied to some input signal and then fed out.
japaneseSummary: 信号処理アルゴリズムを記述する関数型言語。

name: FFP
summary: FP is a programming language created by John Backus to support the function-level programming paradigm. It was heavily influenced by APL developed by Kenneth E.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語。

name: fish
summary: Fish is a Unix-like shell with a focus on interactivity and usability. Fish is designed to be feature-rich by default, rather than highly configurable, and does not adhere to POSIX shell standards by design.
japaneseSummary: インタラクティブなUnix系シェル。機能豊富で、設定は簡素。POSIX準拠ではない。

name: FL
summary: FL is a programming language created at the IBM Almaden Research Center by John Backus, John Williams, and Edward Wimmers in the 1980s and documented in a report from 1989. FL was designed as a successor of Backus's earlier FP language, providing specific support for what Backus termed function-level programming.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語。バックスのFPの後継。

name: Flavors
summary: Flavors is an early object-oriented extension to Lisp developed by Howard Cannon at the MIT Artificial Intelligence Laboratory for the Lisp machine and its programming language Lisp Machine Lisp. It is notable as the first programming language to include mixins. Symbolics used it for its Lisp machines, and eventually developed it into New Flavors; both the original and new Flavors were message-passing OO models.
japaneseSummary: Lispのオブジェクト指向拡張言語。ミックスインを最初に導入。

name: Flex
summary: In computing, the FLEX language was developed by Alan Kay in the late 1960s while exploring ideas that would later evolve into the Smalltalk programming language.
japaneseSummary: Smalltalkの前身となったプログラミング言語。

name: Flix
summary: Flix is a functional, imperative, and logic programming language developed at Aarhus University, with funding from the Independent Research Fund Denmark, and by a community of open source contributors. Two notable features of Flix are its type and effect system and its support for first-class Datalog constraints.
japaneseSummary: アールス大学開発の関数型・命令型・論理型プログラミング言語。

name: FlooP
summary: BlooP and FlooP are simple programming languages designed by Douglas Hofstadter to illustrate a point in his book Gdel, Escher, Bach. BlooP is a Turing-incomplete programming language whose main control flow structure is a bounded loop. All programs in the language must terminate, and this language can only express primitive recursive functions.
japaneseSummary: チューリングマシン非完全言語。ループ構造のみで原始再帰関数しか表現できない。

name: FLOW-MATIC B0
summary: FLOW-MATIC, originally known as B-0, was the first English-like data processing language. It was developed for the UNIVAC I at Remington Rand under Grace Hopper from 1955 to 1959, and helped shape the development of COBOL.
japaneseSummary: 最初の英語風データ処理言語。COBOL開発に影響。

name: FOCUS
summary: FOCUS is a fourth-generation programming language (4GL) computer programming language and development environment that is used to build database queries. Produced by Information Builders Inc., it was originally developed for data handling and analysis on the IBM mainframe. Subsequently versions for minicomputers and such as the VAX and other platforms were implemented.
japaneseSummary: データベース問合せ用4GL。IBMメインフレーム向け開発環境。

name: FOIL
summary: FOIL was the name for two different programming languages.
japaneseSummary: FOILは2つの異なるプログラミング言語の名前だった。

name: FORMAC
summary: FORMAC, the FORmula MAnipulation Compiler, was the first computer algebra system to have significant use. It was developed by Jean E. The compiler was implemented as a preprocessor taking the FORMAC program and converting it to a FORTRAN IV program which was in turn compiled without further user intervention.
japaneseSummary: FORTRAN向け数式処理コンパイラ。

name: Forth
summary: Forth is a stack-oriented programming language and interactive integrated development environment designed by Charles H. "Chuck" Moore and first used by other programmers in 1970. Although not an acronym, the language's name in its early years was often spelled in all capital letters as FORTH. The FORTH-79 and FORTH-83 implementations, which were not written by Moore, became de facto standards, and an official technical standard of the language was published in 1994 as ANS Forth.
japaneseSummary: スタック指向のプログラミング言語。1970年代に開発。

name: Fortran
summary: Fortran is a third-generation, compiled, imperative programming language that is especially suited to numeric computation and scientific computing.
japaneseSummary: 数値計算・科学技術計算に適した、コンパイル型の命令型言語。

name: Fortress
summary: Fortress is a discontinued experimental programming language for high-performance computing, created by Sun Microsystems with funding from DARPA's High Productivity Computing Systems project. One of the language designers was Guy L.
japaneseSummary: 高性能計算向け、Sun Microsystems開発の試作言語。

name: FoxBaseFoxPro
summary: FoxPro is a text-based procedurally oriented programming language and database management system (DBMS), and it is also an object-oriented programming language, originally published by Fox Software and later by Microsoft, for MS-DOS, Windows, Macintosh, and UNIX. The final published release of FoxPro was 2.6. Development continued under the Visual FoxPro label, which in turn was discontinued in 2007.
japaneseSummary: テキストベースの、手続き型・オブジェクト指向のデータベース言語。

name: FP
summary: FP is a programming language created by John Backus to support the function-level programming paradigm. It was heavily influenced by APL developed by Kenneth E.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語。

name: Franz Lisp
summary: In computer programming, Franz Lisp is a discontinued Lisp programming language system written at the University of California, Berkeley by Professor Richard Fateman and several students, based largely on Maclisp and distributed with the Berkeley Software Distribution (BSD) for the Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC) VAX minicomputer. Piggybacking on the popularity of the BSD package, Franz Lisp was probably the most widely distributed and used Lisp system of the 1970s and 1980s.
japaneseSummary: バークレー大学で開発された、Maclispを基にしたLisp。BSDで広く配布され、1970～80年代に最も使われた。

name: Futhark
summary: Futhark is a multi-paradigm, high-level, functional, data parallel, array programming language. It is a dialect of the language ML, originally developed at UCPH Department of Computer Science (DIKU) as part of the HIPERFIT project. Futhark is strongly inspired by NESL, and its implementation uses a variant of the flattening transformation, but imposes constraints on how parallelism can be expressed in order to enable more aggressive compiler optimisations.
japaneseSummary: データ並列処理の関数型言語。ML方言。

name: G-code
summary: G-code is the most widely used computer numerical control (CNC) and 3D printing programming language. It is used mainly in computer-aided manufacturing to control automated machine tools, as well as for 3D-printer slicer applications. G-code has many variants.
japaneseSummary: 数値制御(CNC)・3Dプリンタのプログラミング言語。

name: Game Oriented Assembly Lisp
summary: Game Oriented Assembly Lisp is a programming language, a dialect of the language Lisp, made for video games developed by Andy Gavin and the Jak and Daxter team at the company Naughty Dog.
japaneseSummary: ゲーム開発向けLisp方言。

name: GameMonkey Script
summary: GameMonkey Script is a small, cross-platform scripting language designed for embedding into games. GameMonkey bears many similarities to Lua, except the syntax is more similar to that of C.
japaneseSummary: ゲーム向けクロスプラットフォームスクリプト言語。Lua風だがC風の構文。

name: GAP
summary: GAP is an open source computer algebra system for computational discrete algebra with particular emphasis on computational group theory.
japaneseSummary: 離散代数計算、特に群論に特化したオープンソースのコンピュータ代数システム。

name: GDScript Godot
summary: Godot is a cross-platform, free and open-source game engine released under the permissive MIT license. It was initially developed in Buenos Aires by Argentine software developers Juan Linietsky and Ariel Manzur for several companies in Latin America prior to its public release in 2014. The development environment runs on many platforms, and can export to several more.
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォームのオープンソースゲームエンジン。

name: Generational
summary: This is a "genealogy" of programming languages. Languages are categorized under the ancestor language with the strongest influence. Those ancestor languages are listed in alphabetic order.
japaneseSummary: プログラミング言語の系統図。影響力の強い祖先言語で分類。

name: GEORGE
summary: GEORGE is a programming language invented by Charles Leonard Hamblin in 1957. It was designed around a push-down pop-up stack for arithmetic operations, and employed reverse Polish notation.
japaneseSummary: 1957年、逆ポーランド記法とスタックを用いた計算機言語。

name: Gleam
summary: Gleam is a general-purpose, concurrent, functional high-level programming language that compiles to Erlang or JavaScript source code.
japaneseSummary: Erlang/JavaScriptにコンパイルされる、汎用・並行処理型の関数型言語。

name: GNU E
summary: GNU E is an extension of C designed for writing software systems to support persistent applications. It was designed as part of the Exodus project.
japaneseSummary: 永続アプリケーション向けC言語拡張。

name: GNU Octave
summary: GNU Octave is a scientific programming language for scientific computing and numerical computation. Octave helps in solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible with MATLAB. As part of the GNU Project, it is free software under the terms of the GNU General Public License.
japaneseSummary: MATLAB互換の科学技術計算言語。

name: Go
summary: Go is a high-level general purpose programming language that is statically typed and compiled. It is known for the simplicity of its syntax and the efficiency of development that it enables by the inclusion of a large standard library supplying many needs for common projects. It was designed at Google in 2007 by Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson, and publicly announced in November of 2009.
japaneseSummary: 静的型付けコンパイル型言語。シンプルで高速な開発を支援。

name: Go
summary: Go! is an agent-based programming language in the tradition of logic-based programming languages like Prolog. It was introduced in a 2003 paper by Francis McCabe and Keith Clark.
japaneseSummary: 論理型言語に倣うエージェント指向プログラミング言語。

name: Golo
summary: Golo is computer software, a programming language for the Java virtual machine (JVM). It is simple, with dynamic, weak typing. It was created in 2012 as part of the research activities of the DynaMid group of the Centre of Innovation in Telecommunications and Integration of service (CITI) Laboratory at Institut national des sciences appliques de Lyon (INSA).
japaneseSummary: Java仮想マシン向け動的弱型付け言語。

name: GOM
summary: MAD is a programming language and compiler for the IBM 704 and later the IBM 709, IBM 7090, IBM 7040, UNIVAC 1107, UNIVAC 1108, Philco 210-211, and eventually IBM System370 mainframe computers. Graham, MAD is a variant of the ALGOL language. It was widely used to teach programming at colleges and universities during the 1960s and played a minor role in the development of Compatible Time-Sharing System (CTSS), Multics, and the Michigan Terminal System computer operating systems.
japaneseSummary: ALGOL派生言語。IBMメインフレーム向け。

name: Google Apps Script
summary: Google Apps Script is a scripting platform developed by Google for light-weight application development in the Google Workspace platform. Google Apps Script was initially developed by Mike Harm as a side project while working as a developer on Google Sheets.
japaneseSummary: Google Workspace用軽量スクリプト言語。

name: Gosu
summary: Gosu is a statically typed general-purpose programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine.
japaneseSummary: Java仮想マシン上で動作する静的型付けの汎用プログラミング言語。

name: GOTRAN IBM 1620
summary: The IBM 1620 was a model of scientific minicomputer produced by IBM. It was announced on October 21, 1959, and was then marketed as an inexpensive scientific computer. After a total production of about two thousand machines, it was withdrawn on November 19, 1970.
japaneseSummary: IBM 1620科学用ミニコンピュータ。

name: GPSS
summary: General Purpose Simulation System (GPSS) is a simulation language used for discrete-event simulations. It is especially useful in the modelling of queuing systems, with many statistics being collected automatically.
japaneseSummary: 離散事象シミュレーション言語。待ち行列系モデルに適する。

name: GRASS
summary: GRASS is a programming language created to script 2D vector graphics animations. GRASS was similar to BASIC in syntax, but added numerous instructions for specifying 2D object animation, including scaling, translation and rotation over time. These functions were directly supported by the Vector General 3D graphics terminal GRASS was written for.
japaneseSummary: 2Dベクターアニメーションを記述するプログラミング言語。

name: Grasshopper
summary: Grasshopper is a visual programming language and environment that runs within the Rhinoceros 3D computer-aided design (CAD) application. The program was created by David Rutten, at Robert McNeel  Associates. Programs are created by dragging components onto a canvas.
japaneseSummary: Rhinoceros 3D用ビジュアルプログラミング環境。

name: Groovy
summary: Apache Groovy is a Java-syntax-compatible object-oriented programming language for the Java platform. It is both a static and dynamic language with features similar to those of Python, Ruby, and Smalltalk. It can be used as both a programming language and a scripting language for the Java Platform, is compiled to Java virtual machine (JVM) bytecode, and interoperates seamlessly with other Java code and libraries.
japaneseSummary: Java互換のオブジェクト指向スクリプト言語。JVMで実行。

name: Hack
summary: Hack is a programming language for the HipHop Virtual Machine (HHVM), created by Meta as a dialect of PHP. The language implementation is free and open-source software, licensed under an MIT License.
japaneseSummary: PHPの派生言語。HHVM用。オープンソース。

name: HAGGIS
summary: Haggis is a high-level reference programming language used primarily to examine computing science for Scottish pupils taking SQA courses on the subject. Haggis is used as a tool to bridge the gap between pseudocode and typical computer programming.
japaneseSummary: スコットランド高校生向け、計算機科学学習支援言語。

name: HALS
summary: HALS is a real-time aerospace programming language compiler and cross-compiler for avionics applications used by NASA and associated agencies. It has been used in many U.S. space projects since 1973 and its most significant use was in the Space Shuttle program. It was designed by Intermetrics in 1972 for NASA and delivered in 1973.
japaneseSummary: NASA宇宙開発用リアルタイムプログラミング言語。

name: Hamilton C shell
summary: Hamilton C shell is a clone of the Unix C shell and utilities for Microsoft Windows created by Nicole Hamilton at Hamilton Laboratories as a completely original work, not based on any prior code. It was first released on OS2 on December 12, 1988 and on Windows NT in July 1992. The OS2 version was discontinued in 2003 but the Windows version continues to be actively supported.
japaneseSummary: Windows版のUnix Cシェル互換。

name: Harbour
summary: Harbour is a computer programming language, used mainly to create databasebusiness programs. It is a modernised cross-platform version of the older Clipper system, which in turn developed from the dBase database market of the 1980s and 1990s. It is free and open-source software which license is GNU General Public License (GPL) compatible.
japaneseSummary: データベースアプリ開発向け、オープンソースのプログラミング言語。

name: Hartmann pipelines
summary: CMS Pipelines is a feature of the VMCMS operating system that allows the user to create and use a pipeline. A program writes records that are read by the next program in the pipeline. Any program can be combined with any other because reading and writing is done through a device independent interface.
japaneseSummary: VMCMSのパイプライン処理機能。プログラム間で記録をやり取り。

name: Haskell
summary: Haskell is a general-purpose, statically typed, purely functional programming language with type inference and lazy evaluation. It is named after logician Haskell Curry. Haskell's main implementation is the Glasgow Haskell Compiler (GHC).
japaneseSummary: 純粋関数型、静的型付け言語。遅延評価で型推論もサポート。

name: Haxe
summary: Haxe is a high-level cross-platform programming language and compiler that can produce applications and source code for many different computing platforms from one code-base. It is free and open-source software, released under an MIT License. The compiler is written in OCaml.
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォーム言語。様々なプラットフォームのコードを1つのソースから生成。

name: Hermes
summary: Hermes is a language for distributed programming that was developed at IBM's Thomas J.
japaneseSummary: IBMで開発された分散プログラミング言語。

name: High Level Assembly
summary: High-Level Assembly (HLA) is a language developed by Randall Hyde that enables the use of higher-level language constructs to aid both novice and experienced assembly developers. Its syntax is loosely based on several high-level programming languages (HLLs), such as Pascal, Ada, Modula-2, and C, to facilitate the creation of readable assembly language programs and enable HLL programmers to learn HLA quickly.
japaneseSummary: 高水準アセンブリ言語。Pascal、Ada風構文で、アセンブリ開発を容易にする。

name: Hollywood
summary: Hollywood is a commercially distributed programming language developed by Andreas Falkenhahn which mainly focuses on the creation of multimedia-oriented applications. Hollywood is available for AmigaOS, MorphOS, WarpOS, AROS, Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS. Hollywood has an inbuilt cross compiler that can automatically save executables for all platforms supported by the software.
japaneseSummary: マルチメディアアプリ開発向けクロスコンパイラ搭載言語。

name: Hop
summary: Hop is a Lisp-like programming language by Manuel Serrano for web 2.0 and also the name of the web broker that implements this language. It is written in Bigloo Scheme. It is a project funded by INRIA.
japaneseSummary: Web 2.0向けLisp系プログラミング言語。

name: Hope
summary: Hope is a programming language based on functional programming developed in the 1970s at the University of Edinburgh. It predates Miranda and Haskell and is contemporaneous with ML, also developed at the University. Hope was derived from NPL, a simple functional language developed by Rod Burstall and John Darlington in their work on program transformation.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語（1970年代）。

name: Hopscotch
summary: Hopscotch is a visual programming language developed by Hopscotch Technologies, designed to allow young or beginner programmers to develop simple projects. Its simple UI allows its users to drag and drop blocks to create scripts that can be played when activated. The use of the language is through an iPad or iPhone supporting Hopscotch.
japaneseSummary: iPad/iPhone向けビジュアルプログラミング言語。

name: Hume
summary: Hume is a functionally based programming language developed at the University of St Andrews and Heriot-Watt University in Scotland since the year 2000. The language name is both an acronym meaning 'Higher-order Unified Meta-Environment' and an honorific to the 18th-century philosopher David Hume. It targets real-time computing embedded systems, aiming to produce a design that is both highly abstract, and yet allows precise extraction of time and space execution costs.
japaneseSummary: 高階関数型言語。組込みリアルタイムシステム向け。

name: Hy
summary: Hy is a dialect of the Lisp programming language designed to interact with Python by translating s-expressions into Python's abstract syntax tree (AST). Hy was introduced at Python Conference (PyCon) 2013 by Paul Tagliamonte. Lisp allows operating on code as data (metaprogramming), thus Hy can be used to write domain-specific languages.
japaneseSummary: Lisp方言で、Pythonの抽象構文木を用いてメタプログラミングを行う言語。

name: IBM Informix-4GL
summary: Informix-4GL is a 4GL programming language developed by Informix during the mid-1980s.
japaneseSummary: 4GL言語。1980年代中頃にInformix社が開発。

name: IBM RPG
summary: RPG is a high-level programming language for business applications, introduced in 1959 for the IBM 1401. It is most well known as the primary programming language of IBM's midrange computer product line, including the IBM i operating system. RPG has traditionally featured a number of distinctive concepts, such as the program cycle, and the column-oriented syntax.
japaneseSummary: IBMメインフレーム向けビジネスアプリ言語。

name: Icon
summary: Icon is a very high-level programming language based on the concept of "goal-directed execution" in which an expression in code returns "success" along with a result, or a "failure", indicating that there is no valid result. The success and failure of a given expression is used to direct further processing, whereas conventional languages would typically use Boolean logic written by the programmer to achieve the same ends. Because the logic for basic control structures is often implicit in Icon, common tasks can be completed with less explicit code.
japaneseSummary: 目的指向実行の高級言語。式結果の成功/失敗で処理を制御。

name: IDL
summary: IDL, short for Interactive Data Language, is a programming language used for data analysis. It is popular in particular areas of science, such as astronomy, atmospheric physics and medical imaging. IDL shares a common syntax with PV-Wave and originated from the same codebase, though the languages have subsequently diverged in detail.
japaneseSummary: データ分析用プログラミング言語。特に天文学、大気物理学、医療画像処理で用いられる。

name: Idris
summary: Idris is a purely-functional programming language with dependent types, optional lazy evaluation, and features such as a totality checker. Idris may be used as a proof assistant, but is designed to be a general-purpose programming language similar to Haskell.
japaneseSummary: 依存型付き関数型言語。証明アシスタントとしても使える。

name: Inform
summary: Inform is a programming language and design system for interactive fiction originally created in 1993 by Graham Nelson. Inform can generate programs designed for the Z-code or Glulx virtual machines. Versions 1 through 5 were released between 1993 and 1996.
japaneseSummary: インタラクティブフィクション作成言語。Z-code/Glulx仮想マシン向け。

name: Io
summary: Io is a pure object-oriented programming language inspired by Smalltalk, Self, Lua, Lisp, Act1, and NewtonScript. Io has a prototype-based object model similar to those in Self and NewtonScript, eliminating the distinction between instance and class. Like Smalltalk, everything is an object and it uses dynamic typing.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向言語。プロトタイプベースで、動的型付け。

name: ISLISP
summary: ISLISP is a programming language in the Lisp family standardized by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) joint working group ISOIEC JTC 1SC 22WG 16. The primary output of this working group was an international standard, published by ISO. The standard was updated in 2007 and republished as ISOIEC 13816:2007(E).
japaneseSummary: 国際標準のLisp系プログラミング言語。

name: ISOIEC 8652
